abstracts.cdata!:
The Basic Education Development Project,
            an Adaptable Program Loan (APL) will support Mexico's
            compensatory education program, and as the final phase of
            the three-phase APL program, aims to fine tune the delivery
            mechanisms, based on a fully developed decentralized model.
            Its objectives are to consolidate, and expand quality
            improvements in initial, and basic education, covering,
            inter alia, infrastructure improvements, didactic materials
            provision, teacher training, school supervision,
            implementation of school-based management strategies, and
            continued strengthening of the institutional capacity of the
            states in planning, programming, and evaluating the delivery
            of basic education services. Through its components, the
            project will: 1) provide out-of-school training for parents,
            and adults directly involved in raising small children, with
            the objective of contributing to the child's
            comprehensive development, prior to preschool attendance.
            The training is targeted to families in indigenous, or
            low-income rural communities; 2) support basic education,
            seeking to improve basic education indicators in isolated,
            rural communities, through interventions comprising
            materials, and pedagogic and school management actions in
            selected preschools, in primary and in lower-secondary
            schools. In addition, rehabilitation of, and equipment
            supply for teachers' centers will be supported. This
            includes didactic materials, training and technical
            assistance to school councils, performance incentives for
            primary school teachers, and, support for school
            supervision; and, 3) strengthen institutional capacities
            allowing improved planning, programming, and evaluation of
            basic education delivery. This will be achieved by
            strengthening the pedagogic capacity of State Secretariats
            of Public Education. In addition, the project's
            administrative capacity will be strengthened, as will
            monitoring and evaluation activities.
